it.unige.dibris.TExpRVMAS.core.protocol

Class TraceExpression

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unige.dibris.TExpRVMAS.core.protocol.TraceExpression

  • public class TraceExpression
extends Object
    Class representing the Trace Expression used to model the protocols which guide the runtime verification of the MAS.
    Author:
    angeloferrando

    • Constructor Detail

      • TraceExpression

        public TraceExpression(String pathToFile)
                throws IOException
        Constructor of the TraceExpression class
        Parameters:
        pathToFile - is the path to the file containing the trace expression definition
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file is not found or if there are problems in the generation of the file deriving from the preprocessing phase
        NullPointerException - if pathToFile is null
        org.jpl7.PrologException - if an error occurred during the communication with SWI-Prolog
        TraceExpressionNotContractiveException - if the trace expression is not contractive
        TraceExpressionNeitherAtomicNorAsyncEventTypesException - if the trace expression does not contain only atomic event types (or only async event types)

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(String tExpFilePath)
        Load the trace expression inside the SWI-Prolog environment.
        Throws:
        org.jpl7.PrologException - if an error occurred during the communication with SWI-Prolog
        TraceExpressionNotContractiveException - if the trace expression is not contractive
        TraceExpressionNeitherAtomicNorAsyncEventTypesException - if the trace expression does not contain only atomic event types (or only async event types)

      • getMinimalMonitoringSafePartitions

        public List<Partition<String>> getMinimalMonitoringSafePartitions(List<Condition<String>> conditions)
        Get the set of Minimal Monitoring Safe partitions (MMS)
        Parameters:
        conditions - that must be satisfied by the partitions returned
        Returns:
        the set of Minimal Monitoring Safe partitions satisfying the conditions
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if conditions is null
        org.jpl7.PrologException - if an error occurred during the communication with SWI-Prolog

      • isMonitoringSafe

        public boolean isMonitoringSafe(Partition<String> partition)
        Check if the partition passed as argument is Monitoring Safe for the trace expression
        Parameters:
        partition - to check if is Monitoring Safe
        Returns:
        true if the partition is Monitoring Safe, false otherwise
        Throws:
        org.jpl7.PrologException - if an error occurred during the communication with SWI-Prolog

      • getRandomMonitoringSafePartition

        public Partition<String> getRandomMonitoringSafePartition(List<Condition<String>> conditions)
                                                   throws NoMonitoringSafePartitionFoundException
        Get a random Monitoring Safe partition
        Parameters:
        conditions - that must be satisfied by the partition returned
        Returns:
        the monitoring safe partition selected randomly
        Throws:
        NoMonitoringSafePartitionFoundException - if no monitoring safe partition can be retrieved

        Parameters:
        conditions - that must be satisfied by the partition returned
        Returns:

      • areEventsAtomic

        public boolean areEventsAtomic()
        Get the information about the events atomicity (The events must be either all atomic or all async)
        Returns:
        true if all events are atomic, false otherwise

      • areEventsAsync

        public boolean areEventsAsync()
        Get the information about the events concurrency (The events must be either all atomic or all async)
